definition: to compare/to liken to/metaphor/analogy/figure of speech/figuratively
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to describe sth as/an analogy/a simile/a metaphor/an allegory

sentences.english: This is the simile of the leaves.
Chapter 13 in Matthew is all parables.
Have you ever heard of a pearl necklace?
sentences.chinese: 你有听过珍珠项链的比喻吗？

sentences.english: The cloud metaphor seems more apt.
sentences.chinese: 不过“云”的比喻似乎更合适。

sentences.english: The Allegory of the Cave describes four stages through which a person has to pass to get a sound education.
sentences.chinese: 洞穴比喻描述了人要获得良好教育所必经的四个阶段。

sentences.english: Analogy bear hardships prevenient, enjoy after.
sentences.chinese: 比喻吃苦在先，享受在后。

sentences.english: Mt. 13:18 You therefore hear the parable of the one who sowed.
sentences.chinese: 太十三18所以你们要听这撒种者的比喻。

sentences.english: So we've already seen the trope of the house.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经看过关于房子的比喻。

sentences.english: How would you describe them using positive analogies or adjectives?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何用积极的比喻或形容词来描述他们？

sentences.english: The sutra also lists 250 examples to describe aptly the qualities of bodhichitta.
sentences.chinese: 并以250种比喻恰如其分地描述了菩提心的功德。

sentences.english: But we have further to go with this simile.
sentences.chinese: 但是关于这个比喻我们还有更多有待发现的。

sentences.english: Thirdly, the metaphoric language means the counteraction of moralism.
sentences.chinese: 第三，这种比喻性语言意味着对道德丰义的反拨。

sentences.english: And its meaning is to use the evergreen as the metaphor of the emotion between brothers.
sentences.chinese: 而其诗意则在于用松的常青来比喻兄弟之情。

sentences.english: The saying "To serve like a dog or horse" describes one person's great devotion to another.
sentences.chinese: 成语“犬马之劳”比喻一个人对对方的忠心程度。

sentences.english: This is the second biblical metaphor of life.
sentences.chinese: 这是圣经提供的第二个人生比喻。

sentences.english: Dr Goldmeier uses the analogy of a man confronted by an angry tiger.
sentences.chinese: 戈德梅尔医生用一头愤怒的老虎来比喻一个男人。

definition: to use sth as a metaphor
to extend (the meaning of a word, an analogy etc)/derivation
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
to refer to/to be used in place of
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
